September Will Be MR2s Tenth Anniversary; Tourney Anyone?
Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Cafe: Archived Topics From Prior Years: Year 2009 Topics (Year of the Laboratory): September Will Be MR2s Tenth Anniversary; Tourney Anyone?
By Lisa Shock on Tuesday, April 7, 2009 - 09:56 pm:

Just thought I'd put feelers out for interest in an MR2 tourney. I'd like to see all new monsters, no re-hashing past rivalries. (although we could do an exhibition match with the champion and an old champion)

I know it's early, but, good ranching takes time and planning. So, anyone interested?

By GM on Tuesday, April 7, 2009 - 10:30 pm:

I'm up for it. I've got a Cinder Bird in the freezer I've been wanting to try out.

By Subster on Wednesday, April 8, 2009 - 09:46 am:

I'm playing through MR2 for the 14th time again right now, how do we go abouts this tourny? mail a memory card with our file on it?

By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, April 8, 2009 - 10:46 am:

You can mail a memory card, or get a dex drive and email a save. (if buying online, make certain to get the PSX dex, not the N64 one) The basic rules are that the only gameshark use allowed is to get cash and to take glue out of inventory.

By Zercker on Thursday, April 9, 2009 - 05:19 am:

)=

By Lisa Shock on Friday, April 10, 2009 - 01:35 pm:

Try having the disc re-surfaced. Most Game Crazy stores (Hollywood Video) will do it for like $2.

BTW, This should probably be a no-metalner event.

By Lisa Shock on Sunday, April 12, 2009 - 03:59 pm:

In addition to no metalners, the usual rules are:

no emulator play
no sharking except for cash and glue removal
no sharked parents
entrants will be assigned save slots, and expected to have their monster in the freezer


I am debating allowing capsule monsters and their offspring. Any objections?

By GM on Sunday, April 12, 2009 - 07:20 pm:

By Lisa Shock on Monday, April 13, 2009 - 08:04 am:

By Cear on Thursday, April 16, 2009 - 06:17 am:

By GM on Thursday, April 16, 2009 - 08:34 am:

That's because they have an extremely high Guts regen rate and can launch attacks much more rapidly than other monsters. It would give them an unfair advantage.

By Ladydarkwolf on Thursday, April 16, 2009 - 06:26 pm:

i like to try out of the tourney, but i don't want to send my only PSX Memory Card where can i find a dex drive at a decent price.

By Lisa Shock on Friday, April 17, 2009 - 09:51 am:

I'd suggest getting more memory cards. There's a limit to the number of times you can overwrite saves on a card, so they all wear out eventually. The 3rd party cards are as good as the Sony brand IF you buy the standard 15-block type. Avoid the mega-cards, they break really quickly. HERE's a deal on a 3-pack of new cards. Scroll down, one seller has it for $6.49 plus $3.99 shipping. But, other ones are ok, too, just look for new MIP cards.

Several sellers have new ones on eBay for about $15, which is still a smoking deal - the Dex was $49.99 when it was new.

Remember that the Dex works only with Windows, and requires an open serial port -something many new comps do not have.

By Shen the Keeper on Saturday, April 18, 2009 - 05:45 pm:

Capsule is a food, right?

I forget.

If it is the food I'm thinking of, if its allowed I can enter a monster I made long ago.

She's probably not the best for tourney place (Pixie/Tiger with high stats but low str) but it'd be neat to enter her.. if for no other reason then to celebrate my favorite game ever.

By Lisa Shock on Saturday, April 18, 2009 - 07:18 pm:

Capsules are a combining item that were disabled in the US version. You have to use a gameshark to make them. They allow you to make monsters like GentleMocchi and a version of Moo slightly different from the CD one.

Be forewarned that pretty much all entries will be all 999s monsters...

By Zercker on Monday, April 20, 2009 - 05:36 am:

Question can i put a ps1 memory card into my ps2 or ps3 and save onto it?

By Lisa Shock on Monday, April 20, 2009 - 09:58 am:

Yes. You cannot save PS1 saves on a PS2 memory card. Well, you can kind of store them there, but PS1 games cannot access them on a PS2 card.

By Zercker on Wednesday, April 22, 2009 - 03:16 pm:

ahh ic thank you

By Shen the Keeper on Wednesday, April 22, 2009 - 03:40 pm:

By OgreBattle on Thursday, April 23, 2009 - 04:06 am:

By Zercker on Thursday, April 23, 2009 - 05:16 am:

Does Gamestop or EB Games resurface? because thats the only game store in my area. Well they are 45 mins away.

By Lisa Shock on Thursday, April 23, 2009 - 10:17 am:

Yes, all stats at 999. It's possible, and easily achievable by using a combined monster and/or a raising method. I got a Mocchie from the market to all 999s at 5years and 6 months of age.

A few GameStops resurface. Call them and ask. If you have an indie record store nearby, they may do it as well. Some Hollywood Videos will also do it. you may have to find a friend with a Game Doctor.

There are used copies of the game at The Used Game Trading Zone.

By TracedInAir on Tuesday, August 25, 2009 - 03:51 pm:

How can I compete in this tournament? I'm no stranger to the game but I've been lurking the forums for like ten years, and only after I recently got back into the game was I able to figure out how to max out a monster's stats. I've heard of the Dexdrive but I have a) a Ps2 with a ps1 memory card and b) Windows XP, when the dexdrive seemingly only works with windows ME and lower. What do I do? I've heard about the Dexdrive working for some people with windows XP and that I just need certain drivers etc, is this true? Is there a better way for me to play online? Thanks.

By Lisa Shock on Tuesday, August 25, 2009 - 09:15 pm:

Try downloading the Dexter software, and see if you see the program set up and working. You can get it from the Dex Drive wikipedia page. You will need a serial port on your computer, because the ex plugs in to that.

Other than a Dex, you can mail a save on a memory card to me. You will need a slot assignment, with a save file on that assigned slot and the monster in the Freezer. Email me for information on getting a slot. I will mail the memory card back to you.
